headline: Ask HN: Online course or a printed book – what do your prefer?
description:
This question is related to learning programming languages or computing technology. For example, do you prefer reading (printed) programming language books even though there are thousands of online courses? Or do you prefer online tutorials or courses?

Books:

- Can be read away from a computer (no online distractions)

- Reading on paper is more comfortable that reading on a monitor

- Possibly imparts a deeper understand of material (subjective)

- Computing-related print books have technical reviewers and an editor to maintain high quality (debatable?)

- A book will inevitably be constrained by it's length - not all topics can be covered

Online courses or tutorials

- Show screens and commands more easily and in real-time

- Easier to update and return to newer or refreshed content

- Animation can help explain concepts

- Listening to an expert won't necessarily make their online course good i.e. not everyone is good at explaining or teaching

---

Printed books vs online courses: which do you prefer and why?

Books:

- Can be read away from a computer (no online distractions)

- Reading on paper is more comfortable that reading on a monitor

- Possibly imparts a deeper understand of material (subjective)

- Computing-related print books have technical reviewers and an editor to maintain high quality (debatable?

- 一本书将不可避免地受到它的长度的限制--不是所有的主题都能涵盖

在线课程或教程

- 更容易和实时地显示屏幕和命令
